The most tell-tale and easily repeatable proof of this is to put any amount of talent points into Critical Mass (Tier 5 fire tree) and notice no difference or change in DPS. The fire tree adds 9% total to fire crit (most fire builds) and none of this seems to be considered for DPS. Critical mass alone adds 6% fire crit.

Comments.Message: Actually, the only time that critical mass doesn't effect DPS is when the talent tree is fully empty and you try to drop points into critical mass. To me it seems like it should work regardless if the tree is filled out or not.
The reason why Critical Mass doesn't make any effect when you don't have any talents is because without any talents Fireball is not efficient and the optimizer chooses to use other spells.
I understand completely now. Please close this.
